meanings.definition: To provide support or protection for (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: The sturdy tree backstopped the fragile sapling from strong winds.
meanings.sent2: The fence backstopped the garden from curious animals.
meanings.sent3: The loyal dog backstopped the little kitten during playtime.
meanings.sent4: Her unwavering friendship backstopped me through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The helmet backstopped his head from injury during the fall.

meanings.definition: To act as a backup or reserve for (a team or player)
meanings.sent1: The substitute player backstopped the team when the star player got injured.
meanings.sent2: The extra batteries backstopped the flashlight during the power outage.
meanings.sent3: The second key backstopped the main key when it got lost.
meanings.sent4: The backup generator backstopped the electricity supply during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The reserve goalie backstopped the team to victory in the final game.
